name: Calcium cyanamide
desc: Calcium cyanamide is the inorganic compound with the formula CaCN2. This calcium derivative of cyanamide (CN22−) is used as fertilizer, first synthesized in 1898 by Adolph Frank and Nikodem Caro (Frank-Caro process). It is commercially known as nitrolime.
Other names: Cyanamide calcium salt, Lime Nitrogen, UN 1403, Nitrolime
Appearance: White solid (Often gray or black from impurities)
